data.text: @jskylerinc You know you can praise Janet without discrediting mjs influence right? But hey typical Janet stans. Not only does mjs influence transcends music mjs influence is way more bigger and larger then his sister and he actually has a signature style since we wanna go there.
INDUCT MORE WOMEN! (Especially hard to believe Tina, Cher and Cyndi aren't in yet) https://t.co/wTKKrqkZhl
Having been eligible since 2009, this year marks the FIRST time Whitney Houston has been nominated for induction. https://t.co/fSlJGhLrTM
THREAD UPDATE: Janet Jackson was inducted this year and Whitney Houston has been nominated! https://t.co/ZJweQ25twX
@jskylerinc @lecagle This is one of my favorite songs to play #bluegrass style.
@jskylerinc Wow! I didn’t know.
@jskylerinc Done! Though picking four others to vote for was tough. I think I'd put most of them in.
@Amazingblackfem Mary J. Blige became eligible for induction last year. 😉 https://t.co/ctSOs0tClV
"Taken as a complete artistic statement, Rhythm Nation 1814 was a stunning achievement. It married the pleasures of pop with the street energy and edge of hip-hop." https://t.co/GOWFprSPhZ

"Control is important to the development of R&B for a number of reasons... [Jam, Lewis], and Jackson herself, crafted a new sound that fuses the rhythmic elements of funk and disco, along with heavy doses of synthesizers, percussion, sound effects, and a rap music sensibility." https://t.co/fAQlJgNgCr
@jskylerinc That would just further cement the ridiculousness of the Hall of Fame.

If "Mother" or "Father" denote the innovator of a genre, Janet Jackson is definitely the Mother of Contemporary R&B (and Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis are its Fathers). Even Michael Jackson (who has been inducted twice) never had that cellular influence over the industry. https://t.co/5G9I4iOdO5

And I know a lot of people want Janet Jackson inducted based on the metrics of her popularity (which is valid) but the more critical reason she needs to be inducted is because CONTROL in very literal terms shifted Rhythm and Blues into Contemporary R&B. https://t.co/6hGgmedieM
Anyhoo, please cast your fan vote for Janet Jackson before I put a hex on all y'all houses. 😇 https://t.co/OQuy5i75c5
@jskylerinc would make more sense to nominate max martin rather than the individual artists whose careers he made tbh
Mariah Carey has been eligible since 2015 and also has yet to receive a nomination (she along with tons of women who has been eligible for years). https://t.co/kwFjY50Gh6

Whitney Houston has yet to receive even a nomination for induction even though she’s been eligible nearly as long as Janet Jackson and Madonna.

I’m genuinely surprised there hasn’t been a posthumous push for her induction. https://t.co/aQ9H171EOC
I hope this is Janet’s year, as the Rock Hall itself is reiterating what the rest of us have been saying for decades now. https://t.co/zsTRP5ZdHY

Janet Jackson & Madonna both became eligible in 2007. They BOTH should have been inducted the same year. 

Note: Madonna’s induction happened prior to twitter so you would have seen the backlash except in forums and article comment sections but trust me, rock purist were LIVID.
@jskylerinc 🗣and they will deal🗣

I know a lot of people think it’s hypocritical “no one batted an eye when Madonna was nominated AND inducted her first year of eligibility” now that Janet Jackson is on her third nomination but here’s the thing: THEY DID. https://t.co/0nSLcN69s7

Also: Beyoncé, along with the founding members of Destiny’s Child, will be eligible for induction in 2022. 

Beyoncè will likely at some point receive nominations as a member of DC and as a solo artist. https://t.co/TP3PDIMExh
@jburte Gotta be rocking at least 25 years. https://t.co/cMPuxFYcf5
@jskylerinc @transscribe Assuming there is such a place then, after all the global catastrophe to come.

Her biggest hindrance to induction would be the merit based criteria her catalogue has demonstrated impact on the development and evolution of the industry BUT her BLACKOUT album has already been preserved by the Rock Hall so she’s got a foot in. https://t.co/LtE6N0M10v
@a_taiyib Your first commercial recording must have been released at least 25 years prior to receiving a nomination. https://t.co/cMPuxFYcf5
